text: I'm Macauley Kenney.
Hi, I'm Mike Teodorescu.

And we're members
of team SurgiBox.

Over 143 million surgeries
are needed every single year

around the globe and aren't
able to be conducted,

resulting in millions
of lives lost.

At SurgiBox, we're
seeking to change this

with the introduction of our
ultra portable operating room.

Our technology rests
on top of the patient

during surgery, keeping
the surrounding environment

and the surgical site
clean, as clean actually,

as what you could expect
within standard operating rooms
here in the US.

And when I say the
device is ultra portable,

I mean that when
packaged, it can actually

fit into a standard
sized backpack
and weighs under 10 pounds.

One of our packaged form
factors is right here actually.

And the device is battery
powered with our custom

battery, meaning that
it is grid independent,

and in fact, doesn't
need any existing

infrastructure in order to
bring safe surgical conditions.

With our technology, we're
addressing a $39 billion

market that ranges from
humanitarian relief, disaster

relief, and areas of
combat, as well as

more traditional areas of care
such as acute and ambulatory
care.

The product has
been agency tested,

and over many years of R&D
led by Harvard Medical School

alumni, MIT engineers, Harvard
Business School alumni,

we are now manufacturing
the product.

We're planning to launch it
to the market later this year.

We have existing
partnerships with Doctors

Without Borders and Air Force
Special Operations Command.

We'd love to have your help
to help us bring safe surgery
worldwide today.
Thank you.
